tool.name: MFA Align
tool.description: align a corpus using an acoustic model and dictionary
tool.command:
@PREPARE_ENV@
## 1. Prepare Inputs
## Corpus (Unzip) mkdir -p corpus_dir && #if $corpus_source.ext == 'zip': unzip -q '$corpus_source' -d corpus_dir && #else: tar -xf '$corpus_source' -C corpus_dir && #end if
## Dictionary #if $dictionary_type.source == 'history': ln -s '$dictionary_type.dictionary_file' input_dictionary.txt && #set $dict_arg = 'input_dictionary.txt' #else: #set $dict_arg = $dictionary_type.builtin_dictionary.fields.path #end if
## Acoustic Model #if $acoustic_type.source == 'history': ln -s '$acoustic_type.acoustic_file' input_acoustic.zip && #set $ac_arg = 'input_acoustic.zip' #else: #set $ac_arg = $acoustic_type.builtin_acoustic.fields.path #end if
## 2. Run Alignment mfa align corpus_dir $dict_arg $ac_arg output_dir --job_name 'mfa_align_job' #if $speaker_characters: --speaker_characters '$speaker_characters' #end if --output_format long_textgrid
## 3. Package Output ## Zip the resulting TextGrids into a single archive for the user && cd output_dir && zip -r -q output.zip . && mv output.zip '$output_archive'

param.name: speaker_characters
param.label: Speaker Characters
param.help: Number of characters at the start of filenames to use as speaker ID (0 = use directory structure).

tool.help:
**Montreal Forced Aligner: Align**
This tool aligns a dataset (audio + transcripts) using a pre-trained acoustic model and a pronunciation dictionary.
**Inputs**
1. **Corpus:** A Zip/Tar archive. Structure should usually be `SpeakerID/recording.wav` and `SpeakerID/recording.lab`. 2. **Dictionary:** Maps words to phonemes. 3. **Acoustic Model:** Maps audio features to phonemes.
**Output**
* A Zip archive containing the aligned TextGrids.
